page.title: 16Portex
page.content:
{ Portex}is the largest factory in Hythe, employing about 720 people. It was built in 1964 and has been expanding ever since. They make plastic medical equipment for use in hospitals, especially different kinds of tubing. The tubes are used in incubators to keep babies alive. Others are used for giving anaesthetics into the trachea; these have a special inflatable cuff that stops the gas escaping back up the throat. Some are used to carry blood and others to give injections.
Many heart operations like those for mending holes and bypassing blocked arteries use plastic tubes from Portex. They also make grommets that are put in many childrens ears. Their tubing is also used on animals in the same ways.
